Tumbling Boulder [Attack Technique].name: Tumbling Boulder [Attack Technique]
Tumbling Boulder [Attack Technique].fullText:
Mountain Devotee Attack 11Tumbling Boulder [Attack Technique]

The boulder moves slowly at first, but once it picks up speed, few things can stop it.

Encounter        Full Discipline, Implement, Psionic
Standard Action      Melee touch

Target: One creature

Attack: Dexterity vs. Reflex

Hit: 2d10 + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target falls prone and can’t stand up until the end of your next turn.


Tumbling Boulder [Movement Technique]

The boulder moves slowly at first, but once it picks up speed, few things can stop it.

Encounter      Full Discipline, Psionic
Move Action      Personal

Effect: You shift half your speed and gain a +2 bonus to all defenses until the end of your next turn.


Published in Player's Handbook 3, page(s) 78.
Tumbling Boulder [Attack Technique].flavor: The boulder moves slowly at first, but once it picks up speed, few things can stop it.
Tumbling Boulder [Attack Technique].onHit: 2d10 + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target falls prone and can’t stand up until the end of your next turn.
Tumbling Boulder [Attack Technique].effect: You shift half your speed and gain a +2 bonus to all defenses until the end of your next turn.

Avalanche Throw.name: Avalanche Throw
Avalanche Throw.fullText:
Mountain Devotee Attack 20Avalanche Throw

You grab the enemy as it moves in to attack, and you throw it across the battlefield, then leap through the air to deliver a devastating attack.

Daily        Implement, Psionic
Immediate Reaction      Melee 1

Trigger: An adjacent enemy hits you with a melee or a close attack

Target: The triggering enemy

Primary Attack: Dexterity vs. Reflex

Hit: 1d10 + Dexterity modifier damage, and you push the target 5 squares and knock it prone.

Miss: Half damage, and you push the target 2 squares.

Effect: You jump to a square you can see adjacent to the target. This movement doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks. Then make a secondary attack against the target.

  Secondary Attack: Dexterity vs. Fortitude

  Hit: 1d10 + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target is dazed (save ends).


Published in Player's Handbook 3, page(s) 78.
Avalanche Throw.flavor: You grab the enemy as it moves in to attack, and you throw it across the battlefield, then leap through the air to deliver a devastating attack.
Avalanche Throw.trigger: An adjacent enemy hits you with a melee or a close attack
Avalanche Throw.onHit: 1d10 + Dexterity modifier damage, and you push the target 5 squares and knock it prone.
Avalanche Throw.onMiss: Half damage, and you push the target 2 squares.
Avalanche Throw.effect: You jump to a square you can see adjacent to the target. This movement doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks. Then make a secondary attack against the target.
Avalanche Throw.secondaryOnHit: 1d10 + Dexterity modifier damage, and the target is dazed (save ends).

Root the Mountain.name: Root the Mountain
Root the Mountain.fullText:
Mountain Devotee Utility 12Root the Mountain

You assume a wide stance, digging your feet into the ground to become as steadfast as the mountain.

Encounter        Psionic, Stance
Minor Action      Personal

Effect: Until the stance ends, you can’t be pulled, pushed, slid, or knocked prone unless you want to be. You are slowed while you are in this stance. You can end the stance as a free action.


Published in Player's Handbook 3, page(s) 78.
Root the Mountain.flavor: You assume a wide stance, digging your feet into the ground to become as steadfast as the mountain.
Root the Mountain.effect: Until the stance ends, you can’t be pulled, pushed, slid, or knocked prone unless you want to be. You are slowed while you are in this stance. You can end the stance as a free action.
